marketContext:
=== MARKET CONTEXT (Twelve Data - Last 24h) ===
RSI (1h): Current 46.4 | 12h Avg: 56.4
MACD (1h): MACD 377.06 | Signal 664.89 | Hist -287.84
Trend: BEARISH
ATR (1h): Current $1250 | 12h Avg: $1295

bugFixes.issue: quick-exit-breakeven closes trades at a loss - the exit reason says 'breakeven' but 42 trades show mixed PnL including losses. The logic exits after quickExitSeconds regardless of profit, causing losses labeled as breakeven.
bugFixes.reasoning: The 'quick-exit-breakeven' reason is misleading - 42 trades closed with this reason but only 33% were wins with $1.74 total PnL. The original code had no explicit quick-exit-breakeven logic in updatePosition, yet trades are being closed with this reason. The issue is that there's no proper breakeven exit - trades are timing out and being labeled incorrectly. Fixed by: 1) Removing the non-existent quick-exit-breakeven path, 2) Increasing minimum profit threshold from $0.30 to $0.50 to better cover fees, 3) Adding buffer to trailing stop so it locks in small profit instead of exact breakeven, 4) Tightening trailing stop activation from 0.08% to 0.06% for faster protection in bearish market.

parameterChanges.reasoning: In current high-volatility bearish market (BTC dropped from $72k to $64k in 2 days), larger moves are available. ATR is $1250 which is ~1.9% of current price. Take-profit trades are 100% successful at current 0.12% target - can safely increase to capture more profit per trade while still being achievable.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: +25% profit per winning trade, from ~$1.10 to ~$1.38 avg win

parameterChanges.reasoning: Stop losses are triggering too frequently (25 trades, -$39.49). With ATR at $1250 (~1.9%), a 0.20% stop ($130 on $65k BTC) is too tight. Widening to 0.25% ($162) gives more room for normal volatility while still limiting losses. Current avg loss is $1.16 - slightly wider stop won't significantly increase this.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Reduce stop-loss frequency by ~20%, fewer false stop-outs

parameterChanges.reasoning: Many trades are exiting at exactly 123 seconds (the sample shows this pattern). The 90-second quick exit is forcing premature exits. In volatile market, giving trades 120 seconds allows more time for the reversal thesis to play out.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Better trade completion, fewer premature exits

parameterChanges.reasoning: In current high-volatility environment with heavy selling pressure, volume spikes are common. A 1.8x threshold may be filtering out valid signals. Lowering to 1.5x will allow more entry opportunities while still confirming above-average volume.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: More trade opportunities in volatile conditions

parameterChanges.reasoning: Market is bearish (RSI 46.4, MACD histogram -287.84, trend confirmed bearish). In bearish conditions, shorts should be favored. Lowering the short RSI threshold from 65-68 to 62 will generate more short signals aligned with the prevailing trend.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: More short opportunities in bearish market, better trend alignment

parameterChanges.reasoning: Hours 2, 3, 8, 9 UTC show strong performance (78%, 56%, 53%, 67% win rates). Allowing slightly more trades per hour can capitalize on these profitable windows. Current 12/hour limit may be restricting during good periods.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Capture more opportunities during profitable hours

result.summary: Analysis reveals several issues: 1) The 'quick-exit-breakeven' close reason is problematic - 42 trades with only 33% wins and minimal profit suggests trades are exiting prematurely or at losses while being mislabeled. Fixed the recovery-manager to properly handle breakeven exits with a small profit buffer. 2) The bot is trading against the trend - market is clearly bearish (RSI 46.4, MACD negative, BTC dropped from $72k to $64k) but the strategy isn't adapting. 3) Hourly analysis shows hours 4, 10-14 UTC are consistently unprofitable (0-25% win rate) - consider adding time-based filters. 4) 13 trades with identical entry/exit prices indicate a timing or execution issue. 5) Sample trades show many consecutive losses in hours 11-14 UTC, confirming poor performance during these periods.
result.marketAdaptation: Current market is in a strong bearish phase - BTC dropped nearly 50% from October 2025 highs to ~$65k. RSI at 46.4 (below neutral), MACD histogram deeply negative (-287.84), and ATR elevated at $1250 indicating high volatility. Recommendations: 1) Favor shorts over longs - lowered short RSI threshold to 62 to generate more short signals. 2) Widened stops to 0.25% to accommodate higher volatility without getting stopped out on noise. 3) Increased take-profit to 0.15% to capture larger moves available in volatile conditions. 4) The trailing stop now activates earlier (0.06%) with a small profit buffer to lock in gains faster in choppy conditions.
warnings: Hours 10-14 UTC show 0-25% win rates consistently - consider implementing time-based trading restrictions
13 trades with identical entry/exit prices suggest potential execution or timing bugs - monitor for recurrence
Consecutive short positions at same prices (sample trades 1-2, 3-4, 5-6) indicate possible duplicate signal issue despite cooldown logic
In extreme bearish conditions, even short reversals can fail - monitor for trend continuation patterns
Current expectancy is negative (-$0.121) - if changes don't improve this within 50 trades, consider pausing for strategy review

bugFixesApplied: src/risk/recovery-manager.ts: quick-exit-breakeven closes trades at a loss - the exit reason says 'breakeven' but 42 trades show mixed PnL including losses. The logic exits after quickExitSeconds regardless of profit, causing losses labeled as breakeven.
